words.definition: An ancestor is a family member from the past.
words.example: My ancestors came from Germany.

words.definition: An angle is the direction from which you look at something.
words.example: The giraffe turned its head to see from another angle.

words.definition: A boot is a heavy shoe that goes over your ankle.
words.example: He wore boots so that his feet wouldn’t get wet.

words.definition: A border is the edge of an area.
words.example: The postcard had a pretty green border of pine needles.

words.definition: To congratulate someone is to tell them that you are happy for them.
words.example: Bill and Angela congratulated each other on a job well done.

words.definition: A frame is a border for a picture or mirror.
words.example: I have to get a frame for my friend’s picture.

words.definition: Heaven is the place that some people believe people go when they die.
words.example: When I die, I hope that I go to heaven.

words.definition: If someone or something is incredible, it is hard to believe they are true.
words.example: I have an incredible story to tell you about my vacation.

words.definition: A legend is a story from the past.
words.example: There are many legends about how the world was made.

words.definition: To praise is to show that you like someone or something.
words.example: The teacher praised the boy for his good work.

words.definition: To proceed is to go on or to move forward.
words.example: The road was blocked, so we could not proceed.

words.definition: If something is pure, it is not mixed with anything else.
words.example: The water in the lake was very pure.

words.definition: A relative is a family member.
words.example: I have many relatives living in this town.

words.definition: If someone is senior, they are older or higher in status than someone else.
words.example: He is a senior member of the club.

words.definition: If someone or something is silent, they make no sound.
words.example: The house was silent after the children went to sleep.

words.definition: To sink is to go down into water or another liquid.
words.example: The boat began to sink after it hit a rock.

words.definition: If something is superior, it is better than something else.
words.example: This computer is superior to my old one.

words.definition: To surround something is to be all around it.
words.example: The trees surround the house.

words.definition: If something is thick, it is not thin.
words.example: The book was very thick.

words.definition: To wrap something is to cover it with something else.
words.example: I wrapped the gift in pretty paper.
